name: Triple Lemon Pound Cake
author: foraging4food
summary: This is my adaptation of my favorite classic pound cake recipe. This is not difficult to make, even though it's made from scratch, and it always gets rave reviews.
ingredients: 3 ⅓ cups all-purpose flour, sifted twice
directions: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan
Beat butter in a bowl with an electric mixer until creamy
Pour in sugar and beat until thoroughly incorporated, pausing to scrape down the sides of the bowl as needed
Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition
Stir flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl
Add to the sugar mixture alternately with milk, beginning and ending with the flour mixture
Mix in lemon zest and juice
Pour batter into the prepared pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 90 minutes
Cool in the pan on a rack
Remove from the pan when cool
